title: Is filing two bankruptcies are federal crime? Please read bottom
question: Person has filed bankruptcy on his original name and then filed another one under new name after changing his identity to a new person?
answers: There might be bankruptcy fraud going on. I suggest that you send a letter to the current bankruptcy trustee outlining the facts as you understand them to be along with the evidence to support your allegations.

Possibly, but to find out for sure, find, consult, and hire a lawyer using the Avvo feature "Find a Lawyer". Make a list of 4-5 having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from one, go on to the next on your list.

Well, every petition requests that a person list all aliases and former names, so that should be disclosed.

The person has a new name but the Social Security Number is the same, isn't it?

Also, the fact of previous bankruptcy petitions is required to be disclosed.

Because the petition is filed under penalty of perjury, there could be a problem if there is criminal intent.
